programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: In the 49ers first season without Bill Walsh at the helm, rookie head coach George Seifert was able to stay the course and guide the Niners to another Super Bowl.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: This game was seen by many as a changing of the guard as the Cowboys defeated the dominant dynasty of the 1980s, the San Francisco 49ers, to reach their first of three Super Bowls in the 1990s.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Relive Super Bowl XXIX where Steve Young was able to put to rest any questions about his credentials to take over the 49ers after Joe Montana was traded away in 1993. Young set a Super Bowl record with 6 touchdown passes en route to the 49ers' fifth Super Bowl victory, the first team in NFL history to win that many. 49ers defensive back Deion Sanders intercepted backup quarterback Gale Gilbert's fourth-down pass in the end zone.

programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 21 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Whipsnakes attackmen TJ Malone joins the show! He breaks down the Whips comeback win over the Atlas, and how he navigates the season while working in investment banking. Week 3 was a wild one. Michael Sowers the frontrunner for MVP? Are we worried about the Atlas? Are the Outlaws hitting their stride? The guys look ahead to next weeks "Teat vs Sowers" matchup.

programme.title: U.S. Poker Open
programme.desc: Relive entire final tables of the 2021 U.S. Poker Open and watch the likes of Jake Daniels, Sam Soverel, Joe McKeehen, John Riordan, Joey Weissman, Eli Elezra, David Peters, Jared Bleznick, Ali Imsirovic, Sean Winter, and David Peters win U.S. Poker Open titles.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #5: $10,000 8-Game final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Cary Katz is the chip leader ahead of Nick Guagenti, Alex Livingston, Steve Zolotow, Benjamin Diebold, Jacky Wang, and Brian Rast, as the final seven players play for the $186,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #6: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Masashi Oya is the chip leader ahead of Matthew Wantman, Justin Saliba, Martin Zamani, Jared Jaffee, Ken Aldridge, Anthony Hu, Jesse Lonis, and Dan Shak, as the final nine players play for the $223,100 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 50 players return on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event as Marcel Luske headlines the feature table along with John Murphy. On the outer tables, Josh Arieh and David Williams begin their run up the leaderboard, while previous champions Chris Ferguson and Dan Harrington remain in contention as just 32 players remain.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: There are 32 players remaining on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event. Chip leader Greg Raymer headlines the feature table along with Josh Arieh and Dan Harrington. The elimination of Chris Ferguson leaves Harrington as the sole Main Event champion remaining, while the field is reduced to just 17 players.

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: "Watch a replay of the seventh Friday Night Poker cash game! Chris Moorman, Dan Shak, Randall Emmett, Jon Turner, Hish Salama, Frank Kassela, and Marle Cordeiro a high-flying $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action!"

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Week 1: "Commentators III" features Howard Lederer, Gabe Kaplan, Joe Sebok, Ali Nejad, Mark Gregorich, and Kara Scott.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Week 2: "Nicknames" features Annette Obrestad, Mike Matusow, Antonio Esfandiari, Erick Lindgren, Phil Laak, and Phil Hellmuth.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Week 2: "Nicknames" features Annette Obrestad, Mike Matusow, Antonio Esfandiari, Erick Lindgren, Phil Laak, and Phil Hellmuth.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 1
programme.desc: The first of three festive Poker After Dark nights headlined by Phil Hellmuth featured jolly $10000 Sit & Go! Rewatch the full show as Hellmuth took on Maria Ho Antonio Esfandiari Mike Matusow Dan Shak and Randall Emmett.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2023 | Event #4 $10K No-Limit Hold'em
programme.desc: Watch the Event #4: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table at the 2023 Poker Masters here.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The first open event of the 2004 WSOP would see 834 entrants create a prize pool of over $1.5 million. David "Chip" Reese and Erick Lindgren both fell just short of the final table as the United Kingdom's James Vogl enters the final table as chip leader ahead of J.C. Tran, David Chiu, and Shawn Rice as all eyes are on the $400,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.desc: The hardware store suffers a smash and grab and Dan and Jackie hold one of the culprits.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene seeks to be manager of food services at Mark’s college after feeling they could use some organization.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners relish national cheeseball day. Harris falls behind in her work at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.desc: The comic provocateur tackles a new list of taboos—from race to sexuality to Boko Haram—in front of a live audience at New York’s Town Hall.

programme.desc: Jinkx Monsoon recounts some of the crazier tales from her sex-addicted, alcoholic past, which led to her finding her true self.

programme.desc: Join Queen Monét X Change in her debut stand-up special where she delivers dazzling stories from her life and a bawdy opera performance.

programme.desc: Actress, singer, and all-around performer Peppermint offers an inside look at what it’s like to date in New York City as a transgender Black woman.

programme.desc: In this musical memoir, an international Drag Superstar discusses dysfunctional family etiquette, haunted dolls, and the infamous “Florida Man.”

programme.title: Darienne Lake: Altered Boy
programme.desc: RuPaul’s Drag Race alumni Darienne Lake shares intimate yet hilarious anecdotes about her life, her family, and growing up in Rochester, New York.

programme.title: Ian Harvie: May the Best Cock Win
programme.desc: Ian Harvie is not quite the kind of man you might think. He's redefining what it means to be a dude through a fresh perspective on sex/sexuality with some seriously funny and new kinds of dick jokes. Unafraid to quip about subjects no other comedian has ever touched, Ian’s performance challenges the traditionally macho, sex-obsessed world of stand up in ways you won’t believe, proving that laughter cuts across all identities and ultimately unites us all in MAY THE BEST COCK WIN. Oh and, Ian is the world's first trans man comedian with a stand up comedy special.

programme.title: Todd Glass Talks About Stuff
programme.desc: In this caustic comedy special, veteran stand-up quipster Todd Glass makes audiences howl with his take on some of society's unspoken "rules," from complimenting kids to giving directions.

programme.desc: The iconic comic plays on the challenges of getting healthy, life on the road, dealing with technology and how we all eventually become our parents.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~£100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is the autumn equinox and Monty celebrates the season's apple bounty. Monty also plans for Christmas when he plants bulbs to brighten dark winter days, and he gives advice on planting garlic for the following year.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Spring gets into its stride and Longmeadow is bursting into life. Monty Don prepares for the summer by direct sowing hardy annuals like nasturtiums and calendulas as well as planting barley to give a flush of golden colour in the summer months. Monty also introduces us to the walled garden, an intimate family space where he'll be doing some timely lawn repair. Carol Klein visits the Gibberd Garden in Harlow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty refreshes a container of overgrown herbs, plants alpines and revisits the shrub and perennial cuttings he took a few weeks ago. Arit Anderson meets a designer who is placing sustainability and the environment at the heart of her gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to stake dahlias, sows seeds of perennials and celebrates an abundant vegetable harvest. The team meet a landscape designer in Cornwall who creates gardens that are not only sustainable but also beautiful and edible.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is at home sharing his love of ornamental grasses, tackling the problem of building a patio on a slope and giving some inspiration on what to plant at the base of a wall. In Margate, the team visit a man who has come up with a unique way of using a shed roof to grow vegetables, and they travel to Swansea to meet inspirational gardener Sue Kent, who shows how she has designed her garden to enable her to garden successfully despite her upper limb difference.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty plans for next spring when he plants some early-flowering wildflowers and gives his recipes for the different compost mixes he uses to take successful cuttings. Nick Bailey continues his quest for the South African origins of some much-loved summer bulbs, and in the heart of London, meet a keen gardener who has filled her houseboat with ornamental and edible plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: From giant gooseberries and growing the perfect sweet pea to flamboyant dahlias and plants pollinated by a human hair, this week Monty celebrates the plant passions of some of the extraordinary people featured on the show over the last few years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden, catching viewers up on his new patio project and discussing his plans for the autumn. Arit Anderson travels to Somerset to meet landscape designer Dan Pearson, to find out about the design and planting principles he has used to create his own garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's thoughts turn to spring when he gives recommendations for bulbs to plant that will thrive in pots. He also shows how to prune summer fruiting raspberries. In Norfolk, Frances Tophill visits a gardener who at 97 still gardens every day.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with Billy Carruthers in West Lothian, enjoying his wonderful and varied collection of flamboyant peonies. Joe Swift visits world-renowned opera venue Glyndebourne in Sussex and is given an exclusive tour of their gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty begins the process of taking out plants which are in the wrong place and either moving or dividing others. He also gives advice on making leaf mould from fallen leaves and how to use it.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to prune and train the summer growth of climbing roses and makes the most of the seasonal warmth by planting perennials and sowing annuals. Frances Tophill visits a viewer's garden to give advice on how to prune unruly shrubs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty turns his attention to containers, planting them up for drama and summer colour in the jewel garden and showing us how to repot citrus plants. In Hampshire, Joe Swift meets the designer of an award-winning contemporary garden to explore the techniques and the plants she has used to seamlessly integrate both house and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don's garden at Longmeadow is thriving in the summer sunshine and is looking more beautiful by the day, but the warm, wet weather has meant the hedges are growing like crazy and are in need of a good haircut.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles autumn lawn maintenance tasks, Carol Klein is looking at burnets, and we meet a man who's dedicated himself to a North American prairie favourite, the echinacea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is in Hampshire with the great horticulturist, Roy Lancaster, appreciating the virtues of the often overlooked St John's wort. Joe Swift is out and about too and visits a very unusual allotment in Tottenham, North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe casts his expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol focuses on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow this week, Monty reaps a harvest from the vegetable garden, plants up a seasonal pot and gives a masterclass on how to make the perfect compost. Adam Frost travels to York to meet a couple who took on 20 acres of land and filled it with flowers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn on the horizon, the seasonal planting of bulbs for spring-flowering begins at Longmeadow. Frances Tophill meets a gardener whose allotment is filled with both traditional and exotic vegetables and Toby Buckland visits The Newt in Somerset to find out about its chequered garden history and to explore its emergence as one of the UK's most exciting gardens.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen

programme.title: No Perfect Formula

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives the Ford Focus WRC and the Ford Focus RS.

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1966 Dodge Charger and 1969 Dodge Coronet Super Bee

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay - 2024 Mustang and 1990s Sedans

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Toyota 2000GT and Nissan 240Z
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa dives into the story of Toyota's 2000GT, which was one of the fastest cars in history. Next, Jason gives us the fascinating history behind the Datsun (Nissan) 240Z.

programme.title: Dream Collections

programme.title: The Appraiser | Shelby GT 350 R "Heritage," a 1987 Buick GNX, and a Shelby-style 1973 Ford Bronco
programme.desc: Colin Comer assesses a just-off-the-lot 2020 Ford Shelby GT 350R Heritage Edition. Next, he looks at a 1987 Buick GNX before moving on to a 1973 Ford Bronco that has been modified as if Carroll Shelby himself had a hand in making it.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Pontiac Aztec and an Off-Road Dodge Caravan

Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the world’s best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Florida’s coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the area’s most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP heads to Lake Simcoe for some late Spring, post spawn Yellow Perch fishing action.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Captain Blair returns to the everglades to do an inshore day but is challenged by the wind. Will he be able to find the size Snook he's looking for?

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Army veteran and retired police officer Dan Jarvis details his journey of life in the military and law enforcement and his new mission of helping those still struggling with PTSD from all walks of life!

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Navy veteran John Fleming recounts the life altering effects of his traumatic brain injury which cost him his rank.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: While Randy and Dustin are trying to get the farm ready for Fall plots and create new access trails, Cody is at the river living life to the fullest. Randy finally has had enough and is doing something about Cody’s lack of effort on the farm.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With everything breaking down Dustin and Randy head to an auction to hopefully save their weekend plans of getting seed into the ground.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The Pacific Northwest does not have the easiest conditions to train in for this shooting sports team. For this Seattle-based SST Ravens, this skeet and trap team finds that the challenging weather they train in comes in handy when competing. Also: Competition shooting tips form pro shooter Theo Ribbs.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!
Adam Hays is no stranger to world class bucks, but last year ittook patience and determination to harvest this Illinois giant with3 days left in the season!

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: Grant Ellsworth hunts the Hansen Ranch during rifle season hoping to get remaining hit list bucks “The Big Guy” in the freezer or the “Management buck” down before the rut.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting head to the Rocky Mountains with Browning Rifles in hand after “Wapiti” the Native American Term meaning “White Rump” referring to Elk.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Notoriously nocturnal and living in some of the densest cover imaginable, the black-tailed deer is generally known to be more ghostly than the most challenging old whitetails.

programme.title: The Huntsman
programme.desc: In an age of individuum it feels like it's never been harder to raise and maintain a healthily, caring family. The divorce rate has never been higher, screens and devices are stealing everyone's attention and our children are paying the price. Well, in this episode Chris Waters (The Huntsman) been invited by his friends the Playdon family to their wetland paradise to witness a different culture. A culture that has only recently been at risk of being taken away from us. A culture that celebrates nature, discovery, food, intergenerational skill building, family and, you guessed it... duck hunting! Join us on this Australian family duck hunting adventure.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: While Randy and Dustin are trying to get the farm ready for Fall plots and create new access trails, Cody is at the river living life to the fullest. Randy finally has had enough and is doing something about Cody’s lack of effort on the farm.

programme.title: Full Strut
programme.desc: Skyler & Clayton kicked off their 2024 Kansas Turkey Season and it ended almost as quick as it started. Both of them tagged out in a hurry within the first few hunts. Some of the best 24 hours of turkey hunting they've ever experienced!

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The second split is here, and the crew decides to try their luck at historic Old Hickory in Lacour, Louisiana. Ducks, deer, and mouth-watering meals are all on the menu.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: For DIRT’s first trip across the pond, host Josh Rosen dove head first into Ireland. From long-held traditions to the modern-day artisanal movement, he unearthed the multicultural goldmine between the highlands and the Wild Atlantic Way—with stops for surfing, a seaweed bath, and a couple holes of golf spectated by free-range goats, of course. Foraged cocktails? Fresh crabs from Galway Bay? It’s all on the table in this episode rooted in community, homegrown ingredients, and the damn good people who bring it all together. Subscribe to our YouTube channel to catch up on all of DIRT’s past adventures.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: his week, I welcome back Capt. Neill Holland of Ocean Aid 360! Ocean Aid 360 along with Reef Relief, Surfrider, CCA, Beach Weekend, FWC, and NOAA, are leading a THREE DAY marine debris cleanup event that spans four hours each day, featuring daily raffle prizes, free lunches, and swag bags. They are inviting walkers, boaters, kayakers, and paddlers to join forces for a much-needed cleanup of the area. You can participate for one day or all three! Not only will you have a chance to WIN major prizes through daily raffles, but you'll also be contributing to the preservation of marine habitats and wildlife.The event starts 9/13/23 and ends 9/15/23. You can learn more and join this clean up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/key-haven-coastal-community-cleanup-tickets-709576130307?aff=ebdsoporgprofileAt Ocean Aid 360, the belief is clear: environmental preservation and the livelihoods of marine-dependent communities are inseparable. Captain Neill Holland, a St. Pete, Florida native with a rich background in marine conservation, shares his journey from a career at National Geographic magazine to leading this impactful non-profit.Tune in to gain insights into the remarkable work of Ocean Aid 360 and Captain Neill Holland's dedication to the preservation of our marine ecosystems. It's an episode filled with hope, innovation, and a shared vision of a brighter future for our oceans.Follow Capt Neill on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gofishtampabay/Follow OCEAN AID 360 on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/oceanaid360https://www.oceanaid360.orghttps://www.gofishtampabay.com#MarineConservation #OceanAid360 #MarineDebrisCleanup #CommunityCleanup #CleanOceans #EnvironmentalStewardship #MarineHabitat #VolunteerForChange #SaveOurSeas #EcoFriendly #WildlifeProtection #SustainableLiving #ProtectTheOcean #RafflePrizes #BeachCleanup #ConservationHeroes #EnvironmentalPartnerships #OceanProtection #CoastalCleanup #CleanerOceans #TeamSeasWEBSITES:http://www.saltwaterexperience.comhttp://www.tomrowlandpodcast.comSTREAM ALL OUR FULL SEASONS ON WAYPOINT TV: http://waypointtv.com/#!/saltwaterexperience

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: his week, I welcome back Capt. Neill Holland of Ocean Aid 360! Ocean Aid 360 along with Reef Relief, Surfrider, CCA, Beach Weekend, FWC, and NOAA, are leading a THREE DAY marine debris cleanup event that spans four hours each day, featuring daily raffle prizes, free lunches, and swag bags. They are inviting walkers, boaters, kayakers, and paddlers to join forces for a much-needed cleanup of the area. You can participate for one day or all three! Not only will you have a chance to WIN major prizes through daily raffles, but you'll also be contributing to the preservation of marine habitats and wildlife.The event starts 9/13/23 and ends 9/15/23. You can learn more and join this clean up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/key-haven-coastal-community-cleanup-tickets-709576130307?aff=ebdsoporgprofileAt Ocean Aid 360, the belief is clear: environmental preservation and the livelihoods of marine-dependent communities are inseparable. Captain Neill Holland, a St. Pete, Florida native with a rich background in marine conservation, shares his journey from a career at National Geographic magazine to leading this impactful non-profit.Tune in to gain insights into the remarkable work of Ocean Aid 360 and Captain Neill Holland's dedication to the preservation of our marine ecosystems. It's an episode filled with hope, innovation, and a shared vision of a brighter future for our oceans.Follow Capt Neill on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gofishtampabay/Follow OCEAN AID 360 on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/oceanaid360https://www.oceanaid360.orghttps://www.gofishtampabay.com#MarineConservation #OceanAid360 #MarineDebrisCleanup #CommunityCleanup #CleanOceans #EnvironmentalStewardship #MarineHabitat #VolunteerForChange #SaveOurSeas #EcoFriendly #WildlifeProtection #SustainableLiving #ProtectTheOcean #RafflePrizes #BeachCleanup #ConservationHeroes #EnvironmentalPartnerships #OceanProtection #CoastalCleanup #CleanerOceans #TeamSeasWEBSITES:http://www.saltwaterexperience.comhttp://www.tomrowlandpodcast.comSTREAM ALL OUR FULL SEASONS ON WAYPOINT TV: http://waypointtv.com/#!/saltwaterexperience

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: A factory worker with dreams of being a spy finds himself on the run after seeking a procedure to have artificial memories implanted.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: Set in early 20th-century Montana, this is the tale of a Colonel and his three sons who compete for the affections of the same young woman.

programme.title: Gloria
programme.desc: Released from prison, Gloria finds herself the reluctant guardian of a young boy who has become the target of a ruthless multinational conglomerate.

programme.title: A Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: When an Arizona astronomer discovers a comet heading toward Earth, the president attempts to divert it by using a nuclear missile.

programme.title: Life Without Dick
programme.desc: After shooting her boyfriend, she meets the hitman who had been planning to kill him. As the two dispose of his body, romantic sparks begin to fly.

programme.title: The Throwaways
programme.desc: After a shrewd hacker is captured by the CIA, he agrees to work with them as long as he gets to pick the members of his ragtag team.

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: A young ad executive facing terminal cancer and expecting a child records his life's journey, confronting his past for his unborn child's future.

programme.title: Places in the Heart
programme.desc: This stirring drama follows a widow as she struggles to raise her two children and save her Texas farm during the Great Depression.

programme.title: In the Line of Fire
programme.desc: The story of a man looking to redeem himself by saving the life of America's highest elected official, even if it means sacrificing himself.

programme.title: The International
programme.desc: Interpol agent Louis Salinger and New York Assistant District Attorney Eleanor Whitman track a high-stakes international money trail.

programme.title: Starship Troopers
programme.desc: The sci-fi splatter hit about a military crew of men and women forced into an intergalactic war against a relentless and violent alien species.

programme.title: The Last Angry Man
programme.desc: A principled elderly doctor in Brooklyn remains suspicious when his would-be journalist nephew persuades him to let his life story be told on TV.

programme.title: Pal Joey
programme.desc: Charming musical featuring the love triangle between a lovable but mischievous man and the two women who could change his life, for love or money.

programme.title: Operation Mad Ball
programme.desc: A group of enlisted men, led by Private Hogan, are tasked with planning a dance party, while trying to keep it a secret from a busy-body officer.

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friend’s marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: When a brash reporter starts trailing a runaway heiress on her bus trip from Florida to New York for a big scoop, can love be far behind?

programme.title: Under the Yum-Yum Tree
programme.desc: The machinations of a lusty landlord threaten the bliss of a couple trying to determine their character compatibility by living together platonically.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: You Can't Take It With You
programme.desc: Sweet-natured Alice Sycamore (Jean Arthur) falls for banker's son Tony Kirby (James Stewart). But when she invites her snooty prospective in-laws to dinner to give their blessing to the marriage, Alice's peculiar extended family -- including philosophical grandfather Martin Vanderhof (Lionel Barrymore), hapless fledgling ballerina sister Essie (Ann Miller) and fireworks enthusiast father, Paul (Samuel S. Hinds) -- might be too eccentric for the staid Kirbys.

programme.title: His Girl Friday
programme.desc: A crafty editor for the Morning Post news uses every trick in the book to keep his fast-talking, ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying her new beau

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: The Goddess
programme.desc: As a child, she was Emily Ann, a poor girl in the South with no friends and an ineffective mother. But as an adult, she's Rita Shawn (Kim Stanley), an actress loved the world over. Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

programme.title: The Amazing Mr. Williams
programme.desc: Homicide detective Kenny Williams (Melvyn Douglas) is so attached to his police work that his longtime fiancée, Maxine Carroll (Joan Blondell), wonders if he would rather solve a case than get married. When Maxine convinces the police captain (Clarence Kolb) to threaten Kenny with suspension, Kenny shows his dedication by accepting a case requiring him to dress as a woman. With a killer on the loose, Kenny must decide between his career obligations and his fiancée's wishes.

programme.title: Hamlet
programme.desc: The prince's quest for revenge becomes his undoing when his suspicion is confirmed that his uncle killed his father to win the throne and his mother.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the classic Charles Dickens novel, an orphan on the streets of London is welcomed into a household of trained pickpockets.

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
programme.desc: A daydreamer enlists the help of his British con artist friend to steal and sell the plans for a valuable new oil drill in this spy thriller spoof.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: During WW II, Lt. Rip Crandall and his inexperienced and motley crew get assigned to deliver an Australian observer to a Japanese-held island.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: Last of the Comanches
programme.desc: A cavalry sergeant (Broderick Crawford) leads soldiers, civilians and an Indian (Johnny Stewart) on a desert trek.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: Up the MacGregors
programme.desc: Gregor MacGregor (David Bailey) is celebrating his upcoming marriage to Rosita Carson (Agata Flori) when bandits, led by the evil Maldonado (Leo Anchóriz), steal the family fortune. Determined to get their money back, Gregor and his six brothers go after the robbers. They run across a dentist and his beautiful daughter, who help them find the gang's hideout and retrieve their cash -- but then Maldonado takes Rosita hostage in retaliation. When Gregor comes to save her, he is also captured.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: J.W. Coop
programme.desc: After spending a decade behind bars for writing bad checks and punching a cop, former rodeo star J.W. Coop (Cliff Robertson) re-enters a world drastically different from how he left it; the only constant seems to be his mother (Geraldine Page). Gradually coming to terms with societal changes and cultural norms, Coop is determined to climb back to the top spot on the rodeo circuit. Along the way, he hooks up with Bean (Cristina Ferrare), a liberated woman who helps him catch up to modern life.

programme.title: Montana Territory
programme.desc: A cowgirl vigilante (Wanda Hendrix) proves to a deputy (Lon McCallister) that the sheriff (Preston Foster) is an outlaw.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Dan (William Holden) and Tod (Glenn Ford) look to Texas for opportunities when the war ends. Upon witnessing a stagecoach robbery, the close friends ambush the outlaws and confiscate the stolen funds. Tod wishes to return the money, but Dan wants to keep it. After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.title: The Desperados
programme.desc: A family of Confederate guerrillas continues to kill long after the Civil War has ended. One of the sons breaks with the family to make a new life.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.desc: Lindsay and Will bond after agreeing the dating service that matched them has made a mistake.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team rushes to Mexico, where Chin puts his life in jeopardy in an effort to rescue Sara, his kidnapped niece.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Chin is kidnapped by a Mexican cartel, Five-0 must rescue him before he is executed by the vengeful group; Grover goes under cover to investigate a murder, which turns out to be far more complex and dangerous than anticipated.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: While Max prepares to say his goodbyes, the team investigates a murder during a police convention on the island.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Deddington’s thriving bee Empire has put Granville Norton on the map, but what lengths will they go to to ensure they’re never dethroned…

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fishermen and women flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After a local photographer wins an urban myth competition with his creation of The Wolf Hunter, it unexpectedly gains a cult following. However, when a man is killed, Barnaby and Winter must investigate if this myth has become murderous reality.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A local outcast, who was controversially acquitted of murder years earlier, is the latest inductee into a post-operative heart rehab club. Following his arrival, members' dreams of a second chance at life begin to be cut short.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. The police's detective skills are put to the test as they are forced to solve this case on their own.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual Midsomer Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn as bodies begin appearing on poles displayed alongside their straw creations; the investigation reveals rivalries that run deep and shows people will do just about anything to win.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Mummers, an amateur operatic society, rehearses for its charity concert when the body of an unknown man is found in the theatre; the investigation quickly becomes a race to discover who is desperate to take centre stage.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Each year, the village of Angel's Rise hosts the Psychic Fayre. Founded by the Saint-Stephens family in memory of their late daughter, the event attracts mediums, psychics and followers of the occult. When a body is found surrounded by ritual symbols on the eve of the festival, Barnaby must step into the spiritual world to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy to reveal how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The ghost village of Little Auburn has been abandoned since the war. When a young man is found murdered during its grand reopening, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter must unravel a sinister web of lies from both past and present in order to catch the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Bleakridge Watch patrols the streets of their remote village, exposing anyone who steps outside the law. When one of their members dies, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter uncover just how far some people will go for power...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Tensions run high in Lower Pampling as a new type of cricket threatens a century of tradition. When a star cricketer dies during a tournament, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter's investigation draws them into a dangerous game with a surprise visitor from Barnaby's past...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Winter discover a dead body covered in live rabbits it reveals a sinister side to the local pet show. Is this a rivalry taken too far or is the killer driven by something darker?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young girl slips away from a Jane Austen weekend dressed in period attire, and is found stabbed in the woods, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter need to look back in time to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the annual Thassingham Classical Music Festival draws in big audiences, several musicians anxiously compete for the coveted Falconer Bursary Award. When the winner is brutally murdered and a priceless violin stolen, Barnaby and Winter's investigations lead them deep into a world haunted by a potentially deadly curse.

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Murders team opens up about their experience of working on the popular crime drama and provides insight into the overall process of bringing it to the small screen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Causton is buzzing at the opening of a new brewery on the site of a famously cursed Abbey. But excitement turns to fear when a man is found boiled to death in one of the vats. DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are puzzled; could this really be about beer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Mahesh Sidana - butterfly collector and founding member of an elite IQ society - is found murdered, pinned to a wall in a manner akin to his treasured butterfly specimens, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are thrust into a crime that impacts not only on their community, but internationally. With the help of an old friend, can they catch the culprit before another victim is found...?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Carver Valley’s comic festival is in full swing when the village is shocked by the murder of a former supermodel. With a scathing comic shaming several villagers as the only lead, Barnaby and Winter are left trying to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby gets to relive his former days of sporting glory when a death at the local Rugby Club sends Barnaby and Winter into a muddle of rucks, old grudges, new romances… and artisanal chocolates?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is less than impressed when Sarah drags him to a family friend’s wedding. But things soon go from bad to worse when tragedy strikes and Barnaby is called into action to catch a murderer with an apparent penchant for local brides.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Things take a gruesome turn when Ferrabees Circus comes to town, bringing with it a chain of sinister clown sightings, threatening notes and deathly dangerous circus acts. Barnaby will have to face up to his fears in order to solve the case

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Gated estate Challis Court is a tight-knit community for retired police officers, but when a new arrival is found dead, the other residents regard the murder as an affront. Barnaby realizes that the killer is likely an ex-police officer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer is buzzing with excitement at the arrival of the annual ‘Paramount Dance Extravaganza’. But behind the sequins and smiles are deep running feuds and passions.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The shop has its hands full with a custom psychedelic bike, and Danny's infamous friend.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny tries to get the derailed '62 Caddy project back on track, while Ryan tries to make amends for a mishap by finding a flip or two for the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: This two-part episode starts with a client asking Danny to find and build a 1979 Camaro Z28, to commemorate the first car he ever owned.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny gets a call from Kevin's brother who wants to sell Danny a 1969 Cadillac, but they can't let Kevin know or else he'll never trust his brother or Danny again.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The huge photo shoot day for the Count's Kustoms calendar is approaching.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Get revved up when Danny spots a killer 1967 Pontiac GTO at one of the biggest car shows in Vegas.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and Horny Mike get too close for comfort when they convince a Model-T Hot Rod owner to let them take it for a spin. Later, a Soap Box race car brings out the inner child in Roli and Mike.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin and Roli make an unplanned stop to check out a mysteriously small vehicle. And later, Danny gets a call from Rob Zombie who wants to customize a truck for his upcoming tour.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny can't part with a classic car; a homeowner calls the police on Danny and Horny Mike; Danny runs into a friend and his 1959 Corvette gasser; Mike and Shannon find a Cadillac owned by one of the Superfly builders; extended; includes new footage.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has no interest in a rubber-to-roof restoration on a `73 Chevy Blazer until he hears that it's a tribute to the owner's nephew.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is commissioned by Barry White's estate to find and restore the legendary singer's Stutz IV Porte. Meanwhile, an old pullover visits the shop with a custom job.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Pawn Stars' "Old Man" Mr. Harrison stops by Count's Kustoms with a job that is as unique and old fashioned as he is.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin is won over by a hotrod pick-up truck, Danny tracks down a customer's original 1969 Firebird but its terrible condition may make it impossible to restore.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Ryan and Kevin head to the Bonneville Salt Flats to see The Turbinator, a vehicle that holds a land speed record try to break 500 MPH.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A motorcycle-loving couple wants to hit the road like they used to, this time on a Count's Kustoms chopper.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny takes on a Route 66-inspired Chevy for the famed highway's biggest fan, and later teams up with his good buddy, American Restoration's Rick Dale.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: After two blown sales, Danny finally gets to customize a 1960 Chevy Delivery the way he wants to.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Tasked with building a custom bike for a disabled man, Danny and his team must figure out a way to tackle a tricky transformation.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Chumlee from Gold & Silver stops by to pick up his custom 1963 Lincoln, but gets some really bad news instead.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin and Horny Mike make an unauthorized purchase, forcing Danny to teach them a valuable lesson. Later, Danny runs into trouble himself after acquiring a Chevelle.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny's friend Brian has always wanted to ride a motorcycle, but has never been able due to his physical limitations.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny acquires a '74 Ford F100 he can't wait to trick out and flip for a big profit. But after The Count falls in love with the truck and decides he wants to keep it.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Last year, Count's Kustoms helped Shane surprise his fianc Tanya with a customized classic pick-up truck.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny charges Ryan with customizing a brand new Chevy Silverado for their most difficult customer--himself!

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has big plans for a little street rocket known as a Manta, and the crew commissions an 80s era Corvette.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny wants to fix up and flip a 1978 Lincoln Continental Town Car. That is, if he can bring himself to let it go. Then, the crew transforms a 1954 Oldsmobile Rocket 88.

programme.desc: Corey becomes enchanted with a collection of magical memorabilia; rare first edition copy of "Anne of Green Gables"; a vintage Harley T-shirt makes Corey go hog wild; Rick and Chum head to California to take a peek at a massive Disney collection.

programme.desc: A seller claims to have a cover for a thermonuclear warhead; a mandolin from Bob Willis' Texas Playboys; Chumlee tries to find something he's better at than Rick.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Si has started moonlighting as a grocery bagger, the guys show up at the store and their teasing inadvertently causes Si to lose his job and his chance to enter a local bagging competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a large storm hits Monroe, most of the adults head to Phil and Kay's to help protect their house from flooding while Jess, Sadie, Rebecca and Cole babysit the kids.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie accompanies Kay to a local bingo tournament and gets seduced by the game, eventually embarrassing himself and Kay with his enthusiasm.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie takes Sadie on a tour of a local college in hopes of convincing her to stay nearby after her impending high school graduation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertson brothers debate which of their wives makes the best cornbread, it escalates into a full-on cornbread cook off. Meanwhile, when Jep, Martin, and Godwin play a practical joke on Uncle Si.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys enjoy a one-day rodeo fantasy camp where they learn the ins and outs of riding, roping and clowning.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After leaving school to pursue music, Jase feels that Reed needs some structure in his life, so he hires him to take his place at Duck Commander.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase accompanies Willie on a business trip to Arkansas to pitch a new product and has unorthodox sales strategies. Back in Monroe, Jep and Si have to track down an important item of Willie's that they accidentally shipped out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie thinks his kids have been spending too much time on their phones and other devices so he initiates a "No-Tech Week," but when he has to participate too it ends up being harder than he thought.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase run against each other to become president of their neighborhood HOA. Jep, Jess and Miss Kay work on a Duck Commander themed display for the local zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si, upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise, invests in John Luke's Sno­Cone stand.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.desc: A long-time customer wants his F-250 4x4 lifted and made off-road ready.

programme.desc: Bill and the guys transform a wrecked 2017 F150 into a unique prerunner.
