programme.title: Operation Searchlight: White Supremacist Heist
programme.desc: Mike McCommas acts as point man to the FBI's case against the Arizona Patriots, a white supremacist group. McCommas discovers that the gang is plotting an armored car heist and planning to kill the drivers before escaping into the desert. The group may have pulled it off were it not for McCommas living with them for eight months, and preventing the heist and murders the day before they go down.

programme.title: Operation Insurance Scam Artist: Arson For Hire
programme.desc: Free-lance undercover detective Bob Cerrone is hired by a Denver insurance company to investigate a series of insurance claims. During his investigation, Cerrone is solicited by the insured to rob his office, sink a boat, and lastly, to burn down a row house he owns. When Cerrone protests that there are people living in the apartments, he is told, "I don't care." The detective gets it all on tape and the man is arrested for solicitation of arson.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Three-year-old Kamille McKinney, affectionately known as "Cupcake," is abducted while playing outside a relative's Birmingham home. The ensuing search unifies the city, as residents pray she will be found alive.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Chefs Emily Larsen and Isaac Barreto are tossing the animal products aside in today's Vegan Victors challenge. Will the chefs pull off cooking an entirely plant-based meal to perfection? Or will they end up missing their meat, dairy and eggs?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Three years after his double amputation, Jeff in Albuquerque is ready to reconnect with nature. Kinga is there to root him on as he takes on challenging and inspiring outdoor adventures.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: From cycling on a party boat to practicing yoga in the great outdoors, Rob discovers that Boston’s newest neighborhood is full of surprises.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: It’s a culinary battle of the senses between two iconic chefs in the City Beautiful. Watch as Chef Liz of Garp & Fuss in Winter Park takes on Chef Trina of Se7en Bites in The Milk District. It’s The Knife versus The Whisk!

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Two couples sample bites from around the world, cozy up in nature, get hopped up on caffeine and seek out a yoga glow on two blind dates in Orlando.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nation’s largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand… or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, America’s native spirit.

programme.title: 'Behind the Lens: A Storytellers Project'
programme.desc: Join WGAL News 8's Anne Shannon for "Behind the Lens: A Storytellers Project," where we relive the best of 2024 through the eyes of our award-winning photojournalists.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From stealing an ambulance after leaving a hospital to hijacking a helicopter for the sake of love, these criminals have odd motives and even odder methods of executing them.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In 1990, an 18-year-old driving across Wisconsin to a job conference never arrives. After her van and later her body are discovered, the mystery surrounding Berit Beck’s death persists for more than two decades. What happened in that van?

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Join Esquire’s Dave Holmes as he chats with award-winning musician, Dermot Kennedy, and toasts all things Cincinnati.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: WGAL Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest local news and weather from WGAL.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: A Roxbury iconoclast whose work defined hip-hop’s golden age, Rob ‘ProBlak’ Gibbs made his name with murals, but became a legend by giving a voice to the unheard.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day explore the local bike scene, learn to dance salsa, and get quizzed on their beer knowledge at Two Frays Brewery in Garfield.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Jessy Melo of Jessy’s Clean Meals is back for redemption. Can Chef Nikki Irving, owner of Los Jefes Comida in Taunton, show how she too, can elevate clean and fresh cooking to a higher level or will the blindfold be a game changer?

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: In the otherwise pleasant beach town of Pensacola, you can also find racing crabs, big jerks, burgers smashed, and fruity sours. Choose your mood in the oldest city in America!

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Angel joins baseball legend, Ryan Ripken, for a home run day, exploring the best of Baltimore. They bat 100 at Ripken Stadium, learn about sea life at the National Aquarium, crush indoor rock climbing and show down in an epic cook-off.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: We've got Tech N9ne, the legendary artist who wrote 'KCMO Anthem,' DeJuan Bonds, the barber for the Kansas City Chiefs, and Lisa Peña, a local guide who believes KC is best viewed by foot. You don't want to miss their recommendations!

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Brendan dodges the fangs of venomous snakes, suits up to wrangle bees and sell local honey, and dives headfirst into protecting the future of Florida's coral reefs.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Maxwell, a young professional, is taking a chance on love with three blind dates. Will things get playful with Hannah, stay sweet with Kambree or will Maxwell cross the finish line with Paige?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Everything's better fried, right? Chefs Melanie Kerr and Colin Liang put that hypothesis to the test in this Fry Fest challenge. Will their ideas come out crisped to perfection, or sad and soggy?

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Hit the books, explore underground, and find out why local bites and beds make the Happy Valley so Happy in this legendary college town.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Crab, oyster, shrimp...check, check, check! Find out why Baltimore's seafood scene reigns supreme as we explore all the underwater offerings this Chesapeake city has to offer.

programme.desc: From a para track and field star, to members of an elite octogenarian rowing team and a once-in-a-generation female quarterback, these groundbreaking athletes are 'Boston Strong.'

programme.desc: Esquire’s Dave Holmes chats with Gaten Matarazzo from Stranger Things and shares an Esquire-approved itinerary for your next trip to Boston.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers

The investigation into the homicide uncovers a sordid tale of double lives, sadomasochism and a callous murder-for-hire scheme involving a mentally handicapped handyman.

programme.title: The House Of Horrors
programme.desc: A former army medic devises a sick plan to kidnap women, impregnate them and keep them in his basement as part of a personal baby farm. When the plans turn to actions, two women lose their lives and four others experience the hell of a veritable house of horrors.

programme.title: Incredible Animals
programme.desc: In this episode we'll see the amazing strength of the leaf cutter ant. Find out how fast can a pronghorn really run, and how the desert camel is able to survive in such extreme conditions.

programme.title: Journey to Africa
programme.desc: In this episode we meet the animals of Africa. We'll see how the zebra able to use its stripes as camouflage against its colorblind nemesis. Explore the engineering of a giraffes neck, and feel the power of a hyena jaws.

programme.title: Water
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits an estuary in North Carolina and catches blue crabs, which have adapted to both saltwater and freshwater. Then Philippe goes to Curacao and takes a submersible 500 feet below the surface to look at sea life. We'll also look at the latest NASA satellite that enables us to monitor precipitation around the world. Then we visit a hotel near Quebec City that's made entirely of ice.

programme.title: Earth in Motion
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the various ways our planet is always in motion. We'll visit the volcanic Mt. Saint Helens in Washington, where the movement of the earth's crust caused this mountain to erupt and create devastation in 1980. We'll also discover how mountains are formed and earthquakes are caused. Then we'll look at how our oceans and waterways are in constant motion. And then we'll see how our planet itself is speeding through the galaxy at unimaginable speeds.

programme.title: Route 66: Arizona And California
programme.desc: A Photowalk along historic Route 66 concludes in Arizona and California, where Jefferson Graham takes you to some of the most beautiful and unique places to explore.

programme.desc: The human body is a wonderfully complex machine and scientists are only beginning to understand why some humans can survive extremely low temperatures.

programme.title: The Great Seaweed Invasion
programme.desc: A giant mass of floating seaweed is invading popular beaches in the U.S. and Caribbean. Scientists are racing to figure out how to protect the coast while tracking and studying this natural wonder.

programme.title: Saving The Right Whale
programme.desc: The North Atlantic Right Whale is on the verge of extinction. The leading experts and biologists who are racing to save this species reveal the breakthroughs needed to save the whale.

programme.title: Operation Insurance Scam Artist: Arson For Hire
programme.desc: Free-lance undercover detective Bob Cerrone is hired by a Denver insurance company to investigate a series of insurance claims. During his investigation, Cerrone is solicited by the insured to rob his office, sink a boat, and lastly, to burn down a row house he owns. When Cerrone protests that there are people living in the apartments, he is told, "I don't care." The detective gets it all on tape and the man is arrested for solicitation of arson.

programme.title: A Fugitive And A Killer
programme.desc: When one bodybuilder wants what another bodybuilder has, the end result is a murder-for-hire. The muscle-bound mastermind goes on the lam for nearly a decade only to resurface half a world away and kill a police officer before law enforcement brings him to justice.

programme.title: The Happy Face Killer
programme.desc: A long-haul trucker with a lust for killing crisscrosses the country looking for his next victim. Police don't connect any of this serial murderer's crimes until he slips up and takes out someone from his inner circle.

programme.title: Partners In Evil
programme.desc: Two ex-marines join forces for one sole nefarious purpose – to abduct women and keep them as sex slaves. This evil duo carries out their "operation" with military precision, unafraid to kill innocent civilians along the way, until a petty crime unravels their sinister plans.

programme.title: Operation Searchlight: White Supremacist Heist
programme.desc: Mike McCommas acts as point man to the FBI's case against the Arizona Patriots, a white supremacist group. McCommas discovers that the gang is plotting an armored car heist and planning to kill the drivers before escaping into the desert. The group may have pulled it off were it not for McCommas living with them for eight months, and preventing the heist and murders the day before they go down.
